name: Package
description: Class which represents the current Package

static_functions.name: Export

parameters.name: variable_name
parameters.description: Name of the variable to export

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: Value to be set in the global scope

static_functions.name: Require
static_functions.description_long:
Includes new .lua files

We currently support 5 searchers, which are looked in the following order:
  1. Relative to current-file-path/
  2. Relative to current-package/Client/ or current-package/Server/ (depending on your side)
  3. Relative to current-package/Shared/
  4. Relative to current-package/
  5. Relative to Packages/

parameters.name: script_file
parameters.description: Path to the script file to require

return.description: Any return values from the included file

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: Callback to run on the event occurring

static_functions.name: Unsubscribe
static_functions.description: Unsubscribes from all subscribed Events in this Class and in this Package, optionally passing the function to unsubscribe only that callback

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: Optional callback to specifically unsubscribe to

static_functions.name: SetPersistentData

parameters.name: value

static_functions.description_long: Gets a list of all files in this package, optionally with filters

static_functions.name: GetFiles
static_functions.description: Gets a list of all files in this package
static_functions.description_long: Gets a list of all files in this package, optionally with filters

static_functions.name: GetPersistentData
static_functions.description: Gets the Persistent Value from the disk
static_functions.description_large:
Gets a Persistent Value from the disk
Pass no parameter to return the whole table, or a key to get a specific value

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The key to get the data

events.name: Load
events.description: Called when this package is loaded
events.description_long:
Called when this package is loaded

This event is triggered differently depending on the situation:
  • When the server starts or you run package reload all the event triggers only after ALL packages are loaded.
  • In all other cases (package load/reload or Package.Load/Reload) the event is triggered immediately after the package is loaded/reloaded.

events.name: Unload
events.description: Called when this package is unloaded
